channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Explainer: The oligarchy is more than just one family or firm
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "Oligarchs and rich families are still very much in power and in control of the social wealth, the national economy, and remain decisive in government policies."

item.title: 44 petitioners ask SC to void anti-terrorism law for curtailing civil liberties
item.description: "The law forces the public to barter their freedoms in exchange for security from evils that the government has yet to even credibly demonstrate to exist," the petitioners said.

item.title: Weak La Niña possible in October
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: A weak La Niña is expected to develop over the country by late October or November this year, according to the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services.

item.title: International solidarity fund vs COVID-19 launched
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A solidarity fund will be awarded to six regions around the world, including Asia, to accelerate the response against the coronavirus disease, a global alliance involved in raising funds to address non-communicable diseases announced recently.

item.title: Group warns of public health system breakdown
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Alliance of Health Workers yesterday warned of a possible breakdown of the public health system as the spread of coronavirus disease 2019 continues.

item.title: 10 members of Gordon staff positive for COVID-19
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Ten staff members of Sen. Richard Gordon tested positive for coronavirus disease 2019 and were immediately sent to quarantine, the office of the senator announced yesterday.

item.title: DILG exec pushes shame campaign vs stubborn COVID-19 patients
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: An undersecretary of the Department of the Interior and Local Government is advocating a “shame campaign” against coronavirus disease 2019 patients who will refuse to undergo quarantine at government facilities amid the pandemic.

item.title: DPWH provides dormitories for Lung Center personnel
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: Medical personnel of the Lung Center of the Philippines now have a temporary shelter within the hospital compound in Quezon City.

item.title: Poe wants electronic governance institutionalized
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Grace Poe is pushing for a measure that would mandate the institutionalization of electronic governance for swift response concerns of citizens amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Lawmaker seeks suspension of emission tests
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: Cagayan de Oro Rep. Rufus Rodriguez has sought the suspension of the smoke emission testing for motor vehicle registration required by the Land Transportation Office.
